metadata.title: Tap Sequence Test - Prompt Engineering
metadata.description: Test simulation for tap_sequence interaction types

simulations.title: Prompt Engineering Basics
simulations.description: Learn to build and refine AI prompts

theory_content.title: Build a Structured Prompt Foundation
key_points: Define role, level, and experience clearly.
Add company context to guide tone and scope.
Avoid vague wording that makes AI guess.

step_level_design.instruction_question: Complete the 4 missing parts of the prompt by tapping options in order.
step_level_design.artefact_interaction_description: A live prompt draft is shown with 4 blanks. Tap one option per blank in order. You may change a selection before completing all 4. The step proceeds automatically when all blanks are filled.
step_level_design.artefact_prompt_template:
Write a job description for [BLANK_1] ([BLANK_2]) at a [BLANK_3].
Include sections: [BLANK_4].
options_inputs: Responsibilities, Must-Have Skills, Nice-to-Have Skills, Impact Expectations

outcomes.correct: Prompt is specific and structured, leading to clean, usable AI output.
outcomes.partially_correct: Prompt is somewhat usable but AI may guess structure or inflate requirements.
outcomes.incorrect: Prompt remains vague or misaligned, causing generic or bloated output.

theory_content.title: Control Bias and Requirement Inflation in the Prompt
key_points: Prevent issues in the prompt, not after generation.
Use clear constraints instead of vague improvements.

step_level_design.instruction_question: Tap exactly 2 problematic lines in the prompt. Then tap exactly 2 replacement constraints.
step_level_design.artefact_interaction_description: The full prompt draft is displayed below. First tap 2 lines that will cause biased or inflated output. Then tap 2 replacement lines. You can deselect any line before the second replacement is chosen. The step proceeds after 2 flags and 2 replacements.
step_level_design.artefact_prompt_displayed:
Write a job description for a Senior Data Scientist (5+ years experience) at a fast-growing tech startup.
Include sections: Responsibilities, Must-Have Skills, Nice-to-Have Skills, Impact Expectations.
Make it exciting and aggressive.
List as many skills as relevant.
options_inputs: List as many skills as relevant.
Use professional, inclusive language. Avoid jargon like rockstar, ninja, guru.
Separate Must-Have Skills and Nice-to-Have Skills. Limit Must-Have Skills to 5 core competencies aligned to actual job needs.
Manually edit the JD after generation.
step_level_design.progression_condition: 2 problematic lines flagged AND 2 replacements selected

outcomes.correct: Regenerated JD removes biased tone and controls requirement inflation.
outcomes.partially_correct: Tone improves but requirements remain inflated or vague.
outcomes.incorrect: Bias or inflation persists, increasing manual correction effort.
